alert.note: Alert for Allen; De Kalb; Noble (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:01PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Allen, southeastern Noble, northeastern Whitley and southwestern De Kalb Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Churubusco, or 9 miles northeast of Tri-lakes, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Wayne, Huntertown, Avilla, Churubusco, Leo-cedarville, Swan, Ege, Green Center, Butler Center, Merriam, Blue Lake, Wallen, Laotto, Ari and Lake Everett. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 26 and 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 313 and 321. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
